Switch clarity ON OFF Privacy policy close Study Research Explore Connect School of Computing Science Our staffNikela PapadopoulouMr Ethan KellyZhen Tian Dr Nikela Papadopoulou Lecturer in Low Carbon and Sustainable Computing (School of Computing Science) email: Nikela.Papadopoulou@glasgow.ac.uk Room F133, 18 Lilybank Gardens, Glasgow, Glasgow City, Scotland, United Kingdom, G12 8RZ Import to contacts https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2141-5654 Biography I am a Lecturer (Assistant Professor) in Low Carbon and Sustainable Computing at the School of Computing Science, University of Glasgow, and a member of the GLAsgow Systems Section. My research explores the optimization of high-performance computing (HPC) systems for reduced environmental impact. This includes performance modeling, application optimization and co-design, and resource management strategies with a focus on energy efficiency. I have a keen interest in applying these techniques to machine learning workloads. Prior to joining the University of Glasgow, I held post-doctoral research positions at Chalmers University of Technology in Sweden, and the National Technical University of Athens in Greece, where I contributed to several European R&D projects in the area of high-performance and cloud computing (ACTiCLOUD, EuroEXA, CYBELE, HiDALGO, REGALE, eProcessor, EUPILOT).  I hold a PhD in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the National Technical University of Athens. I am a member of ACM and HiPEAC.
